message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, but only if you confirm that you're willing to buy it immediately. If you're not, I'll keep the price at $10000. What do you say?
I'm not ready to make a decision yet. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

No pressure, I completely understand. Let me offer you a deal on this one. I'll give you a 5% discount on the price of $10000, but only if you're willing to buy it now. I'm not obligated to give you a discount on the next product, so it's a one-time offer. What do you say?
I'm still not ready to buy. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand you're being cautious. I'll be transparent with you - I've had a string of low-quality products lately, and I'm starting to think I might need to re-evaluate my sourcing. This one, for example, is not up to par. But I'm willing to let you have it for $8000, which is a significant discount from the usual price. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how many more low-quality products I'll have left in stock.
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm still not convinced that this is the best opportunity for me. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand you're being cautious, but I think I can change your mind. I've got a high-quality product for you, and I'm willing to offer it to you at the full price of $10000. I'm confident that this one will meet your expectations, and I'm willing to give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. What do you say?
I'll take the product. I'm willing to take the risk and pay the full price for a potential $40000 value.

Congratulations on making a great decision earlier! I'm glad you're happy with the high-quality product. Now, regarding this next product... I have to be honest with you, I've had some issues with this one. The quality is not up to par, and I'm not even sure if it's worth the usual $10000 price tag. I'm willing to let you have it for $6000, but only if you're willing to take on the risk. I'll throw in a 1-year warranty, and I'll also give you a 10% discount on your next purchase if you decide to buy this one. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a potentially low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at the full price.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make you a special offer. I've had this product in stock for a while, and I'm willing to let you have it for $5000, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I'll also throw in a free maintenance service for the next 6 months, so you can be sure it's properly taken care of. I'm not sure how many more low-quality products I'll have left, so this might be your last chance to get a deal on one.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not interested in buying a potentially low-quality product. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at the full price.

I think I've got a winner for you! This product is top-notch, and I'm confident you'll be impressed. I'll let you have it for $10000, which is the full price, but I'll throw in a premium after-sales support package, which includes priority service and a dedicated account manager. This way, you'll get the best possible experience with this high-quality product. What do you say?
I'll take the product. I'm willing to pay the full price for a high-quality product and the added benefits of the premium after-sales support package.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! Unfortunately, this next product is not up to par. I'm not even sure if it's worth the usual $10000 price tag. I'm willing to let you have it for $4000, but that's as low as I can go. I'm not making any promises about its performance, and I'm not offering any warranty or support. It's a take-it-or-leave-it offer. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a potentially low-quality product at any price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at the full price.

I understand your stance, and I respect it. However, I want to be transparent with you - I've had a string of low-quality products lately, and I'm starting to think I need to shut down my operation if I can't get my sourcing right. This product is a last chance for me to make things right, and I'm willing to let you have it for $3000. It's a fire-sale price, and I'm not making any promises about its performance. If you don't take it, I'll have to close up shop.

I'm sorry to hear that you're struggling, but I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even at a very low price. I'd rather see you succeed in the future, but I need to prioritize my own interests.

I completely understand, and I appreciate your honesty. I'm not expecting you to take a risk on a low-quality product, especially at this point. I'm actually willing to give up on this product altogether and take a loss. I'll just give it to you for free, no strings attached. I'd rather have a clear conscience and a chance to regroup and improve my sourcing than to try to sell you something that's not up to par.

I appreciate your honesty and willingness to take a loss. I'll take the product, but I want to make it clear that I'm only doing so because it's free, and I'm not expecting it to be of any value to me.

I completely understand your position, and I appreciate your willingness to give me another chance. However, I have to be honest with you, this next product is not even worth giving away. It's a complete dud, and I'm not even sure why I bothered bringing it in. I'll be honest with you, I'm not even going to offer it to you for free. I'll just take it back and try to sell it to someone else. You're off the hook on this one.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not going to bother trying to buy a product that you're not even willing to give away. I'll just wait for the next product.

No more products, no more sales pitches. I'm done.
I appreciate your honesty and transparency. I think it's for the best that you're shutting down your operation. I'm glad I could help you see that it was time to move on.
